content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

The main image shows two structures made of building blocks:

## Left Structure (Smaller):
- Total blocks: 3 blocks
- Layers: 2 layers
- Composition:
  - Bottom layer: 1 red arch block
  - Top layer: 2 cube blocks (1 blue and 1 yellow) placed side by side

## Right Structure (Larger):
- Total blocks: 7 blocks
- Layers: 3 layers
- Composition:
  - Bottom layer: 2 red arch blocks placed parallel to each other
  - Middle layer: 3 blocks - 1 long yellow rectangular block spanning across the two red arches, plus 2 red blocks with arches on top
  - Top layer: 2 yellow rectangular/cube blocks that sit partially within the arches of the red blocks

# Block Selection from Dictionary

Based on the structures shown, I need the following blocks:

For the Left Structure:
- Block #1 (red arch block)
- Block #7 (blue cube)
- Block #11 (yellow cube)

For the Right Structure:
- Block #1 (red arch block) - need 2 of these
- Block #2 (red arch block) - need 2 of these
- Block #12 (yellow rectangular block, horizontal orientation)
- Block #11 (yellow cube) - need 2 of these

# Assembly Instructions

```
{
   Step1: Move block with index 1
   Step2: Move block with index 7
   Step3: Move block with index 11
   Step4: Move block with index 1
   Step5: Move block with index 2
   Step6: Move block with index 12
   Step7: Move block with index 2
   Step8: Move block with index 1
   Step9: Move block with index 11
   Step10: Move block with index 11
}
```

The assembly order follows a bottom-to-top approach, building the left structure first and then the right structure.
